edu.rit.pj2

Class LoopBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.LoopBody
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LongLoop, Loop, ObjectLoop

    public abstract class LoopBody
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    Class LoopBody is the abstract base class for a loop body executed by a parallel for loop.
    See Also:
    ParallelStatement, ParallelForLoop, Loop, LongLoop, ObjectLoop, Schedule

      Construct a new loop object.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws Exception
        Perform one-time initialization actions for this loop object.

        The start() method may be overridden in a subclass. The default start() method does nothing.

        Throws:
        Exception - The start() method may throw any exception.

      • finish

        public void finish()
            throws Exception
        Perform one-time finalization actions for this loop object.

        The finish() method may be overridden in a subclass. The default finish() method does nothing.

        Throws:
        Exception - The finish() method may throw any exception.

      • threadLocal

        public <V extends Vbl> V threadLocal(V global)
        Get a thread-local copy of the given global shared variable. The global variable and the local variable are instances of a subclass of class Vbl. The loop can update the local variable without needing to synchronize with other threads. When the loop finishes execution, all the local copies are automatically reduced together using the Vbl subclass's reduce() method, and the result is stored into the global variable (overwriting whatever was there).

        The threadLocal() method may only be called from the start(), run(), or finish() methods.

        Type Parameters:
        V - Shared variable data type.
        Parameters:
        global - Global shared variable.
        Returns:
        Thread-local copy of global.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the threadLocal() method is not called from the start(), run(), or finish() methods.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop this loop (early loop exit). Loop iterations will no longer be performed in any thread executing this loop object.

        The stop() method may only be called from the start(), run(), or finish() methods.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the stop() method is not called from the start(), run(), or finish() methods.

      • threads

        public int threads()
        Returns the number of threads in the thread team executing this loop object.

        The threads() method may only be called from the start(), run(), or finish() methods.

        Returns:
        Number of threads.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the threads() method is not called from the start(), run(), or finish() methods.

      • rank

        public int rank()
        Returns the rank of the thread executing this loop object.

        The rank() method may only be called from the start(), run(), or finish() methods.

        Returns:
        Rank in the range 0 .. threads()−1.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the rank() method is not called from the start(), run(), or finish() methods.

      • clone

        public Object clone()
        Create a clone of this loop object.
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object
        Returns:
        The cloned object.
